dt: {bc}material used to {a_link|stuff} or fill: such as
{bc}a soft material (such as cotton or polyester) used to fill upholstered furniture, cushions, bedding, etc.
{bc}a seasoned mixture (as of bread crumbs, vegetables, and butter) that is typically placed inside the cavity of a turkey, pepper, etc. and cooked

shortdef: material used to stuff or fill: such as
a soft material (such as cotton or polyester) used to fill upholstered furniture, cushions, bedding, etc.
a seasoned mixture (as of bread crumbs, vegetables, and butter) that is typically placed inside the cavity of a turkey, pepper, etc. and cooked

dt.t: the boy {wi}stuffed{/wi} his pockets with candy

dt: {bc}to prepare (meat or vegetables) by filling or lining with a {a_link|stuffing}
{bc}to fill (something, such as a cushion) with a soft material
{bc}to fill out the skin of (an animal) for mounting
{bc}to fill or block up (something, such as nasal passages)

dt.t: {wi}stuffed{/wi} a lot of clothing into a laundry bag

dt: {bc}to put (a ball, a puck, etc.) into a goal forcefully from close range
used in the imperative to express contempt
often used in the phrases {it}stuff it{/it} and {it}get stuffed{/it}
{bc}to stop (a ballcarrier) abruptly in a football game

dt.t: {wi}stuffed{/wi} the runner just short of a first down

shortdef: to fill by packing things in : cram
to prepare (meat or vegetables) by filling or lining with a stuffing

dt: {bc}a device that prevents leakage along a moving part (such as a connecting rod) passing through a hole in a vessel (such as a cylinder) containing steam, water, or oil and that consists of a box or chamber made by enlarging the hole and a gland to compress the contained packing

shortdef: a device that prevents leakage along a moving part (such as a connecting rod) passing through a hole in a vessel (such as a cylinder) containing steam, water, or oil and that consists of a box or chamber made by enlarging the hole and a gland to compress the contained packing

dt: {bc}to cause (someone) to lose energy and confidence {bc}to make (someone) feel weak or overwhelmed

dt.t: When he found out that he didn't get the job, it really {it}knocked the stuffing out of{/it} him.

shortdef: to cause (someone) to lose energy and confidence : to make (someone) feel weak or overwhelmed

dt: {bc}to attempt to control the outcome of an election by having multiple illegitimate votes cast in support of the desired candidate

dt.t: They said the vote-rigging included {wi}stuffing ballot boxes{/wi}, buying votes and absent names on the voter rolls.
By a margin of just 277 votes (some say {wi}ballot boxes were stuffed){/wi}, Brooklyn, the nation's fourth-largest city, had voted to give up its proud and independent history.
